page.title: 06N.Tanton Farm,Nr. Gt.Ayton
page.content: North Tanton Farm's 200 acres belong to Mr.Neil Metcalf. The farm's boundary has a piece cut out of it where a field was lost in a game of cards. He breeds pheasants, and has about 90 being reared by broody hens in chicken runs. He also stores caravans for people with small urban gardens and one small field is full of caravans. A 10 cm. flint knife was found in one of his fields, where there are the remains of an iron age village to the N.E. of the farm house. The village of Tameston now lies under the sheep pasture west of the farm. Most of the fields are under wheat,barley and potatoes. All odd corners of the farm have trees planted as a conservation measure: Mr.Metcalf has been planting 200-300 a year.
